0x000.name: Walk Initial Velocity
0x000.description: The starting velocity obtained the moment the character starts walking.

0x004.name: Walk Acceleration
0x004.description: The speed of acceleration while walking.

0x008.name: Walk Maximum Velocity
0x008.description: The maximum velocity obtainable while walking.

0x00C.name: Ground Friction
0x00C.description: The speed which the character's horizontal velocity decreases on its own on the ground.

0x010.name: Dash & StopTurn Initial Velocity
0x010.description: The starting velocity obtained the moment the character starts a Dash.

0x014.name: Dash & Run Acceleration A
0x014.description: The speed at which the character decelerates during Dash, Run, and Turn Run. Combines with 0x018.

0x018.name: Dash & Run Acceleration B
0x018.description: The speed at which the character accelerates during Dash, Run, and Turn Run. Combines with 0x014.

0x01C.name: Dash & Run Terminal Velocity
0x01C.description: The velocity you will accelerate to during a Dash or Run.

0x020.name: Run Acceleration?
0x020.description: Possibly the time it takes for the character to reach full speed during a run?

0x024.name: General Grounded Max Horizontal Velocity
0x024.description: The maximum horizontal velocity you can have while on the ground.

0x028.name: Dash Cancel Frame Window?
0x028.description: Possibly the amount of frames you have to cancel your dash animation.

0x02C.name: Guard On Max Momentum
0x02C.description: The maximum horizontal momentum you can have when entering shield.

0x030.name: Jump Startup Time
0x030.description: The time in frames it takes for your character to lift off of the ground when jumping.

0x034.name: Jump H Initial Velocity
0x034.description: The starting horizontal velocity the character obtains when jumping.

0x038.name: Jump V Initial Velocity
0x038.description: The starting vertical velocity the character obtains when jumping.

0x03C.name: Ground to Air Jump Momentum Multiplier
0x03C.description: The amount of horizontal momentum from the ground that gets added onto a jump.

0x040.name: Jump H Initial Velocity
0x040.description: The maximum starting horazontal velocity the character is able to obtain when jumping.

0x044.name: Hop V Initial Velocity
0x044.description: The maximum vertical velocity the character obtains when hopping.

0x048.name: V Air Jump Multiplier
0x048.description: The velocity obtained from an air jump proportional to the Jump V Initial Velocity.

0x04C.name: H Air Jump Multiplier
0x04C.description: The velocity obtained from an air jump proportional to the Jump H Initial Velocity.

0x050.name: Footstool Jump V Initial Velocity
0x050.description: The starting vertical velocity the character obtains upon performing a footstool jump.

0x054.name: Footstool Hop V Initial Velocity
0x054.description: The starting vertical velocity the character obtains upon performing a footstool hop (quick press).

0x05C.name: Meteor Canceling Window
0x05C.description: Numbers of frames into meteor knockback before the character can perform a meteor cancel.

0x060.name: Jumps
0x060.description: The number of consecutive jumps the character is able to perform. (Note: This changes nothing without BEx FighterConfig edits and a Multijump section in Misc.)

0x064.name: Gravity
0x064.description: The speed at which the character accelerates downward.

0x068.name: Terminal Velocity
0x068.description: The maximum velocity obtainable due to gravity.

0x06C.name: V Air Friction
0x06C.description: Appears to have little to no effect, though seems to nullify terminal velocity when set to 0.

0x074.name: Air Mobility A
0x074.description: The speed at which the character is able to maneuver in the air. Combines with 0x078.

0x078.name: Air Mobility B
0x078.description: The speed at which the character is able to maneuver in the air. Combines with 0x074.

0x07C.name: Maximum H Air Mobility
0x07C.description: The maximum horizontal velocity the character is able to obtain in the air using air mobility.

0x080.name: H Air Friction
0x080.description: The speed at which the character's horizontal velocity decreases on its own in the air.

0x084.name: Fastfall Terminal Velocity
0x084.description: The fastfalling speed of the character.

0x088.name: Aerial Max H Velocity
0x088.description: Applies when double jumping, possibly at other times as well. Appears to always be 2.5 in Project M.

0x08C.name: Glide Frame Window
0x08C.description: The amount of time (in frames) that the character has to begin a glide after jumping. Leave at 0 for no glide.

0x0A8.name: Frames to Turn Around
0x0A8.description: The number of frames it takes during a slow standing turn before changing direction.

0x0B0.name: Weight
0x0B0.description: How resiliant the character is to knockback.

0x0B4.name: Size
0x0B4.description: The scaling of the character from their original model size. 1 = 100%, 0.5 = 50%.

0x0B8.name: Size on Results Screen
0x0B8.description: The scaling of the character on the results screen. 1 = 100%, 0.5 = 50%.

0x0C4.name: Shield Size
0x0C4.description: The size of the character's shield bubble when it is at full strength.

0x0C8.name: Shield Break Bounce Velocity
0x0C8.description: The velocity at which the character bounces upwards upon having their shield broken.

0x0D0.name: Item GFX Size
0x0D0.description: Increases the size of the healing circle GFX (Food, Maximum Tomato, and Heart Container), the Starman sparkle GFX, and the Bunny Hood.

0x0D4.name: Respawn Platform Size
0x0D4.description: The size of the platform the character respawns on after a K.O.

0x0E8.name: Rapid Jab Button Mashing?
0x0E8.description: Unknown, could relate to button mashing for Rapid Jab (Ex: Pit).

0x0F8.name: Edge Jump H Velocity
0x0F8.description: The starting horazontal velocity obtained from an Edge Jump.

0x0FC.name: Edge Jump V Velocity
0x0FC.description: The starting vertical velocity obtained from an Edge Jump.

0x100.name: Heavy Item Move Speed
0x100.description: The speed the character has when carrying a heavy item, such as a crate.

0x104.name: Heavy Item Traction
0x104.description: The amount of traction the character has when carrying a heavy item, such as a crate.

0x118.name: Item Throw Strength
0x118.description: The speed at which an item is projected when thrown.

0x128.name: Projectile Weapon Use Move Speed
0x128.description: The speed at which the character is able to move at while firing a projectile weapon.

0x12C.name: Projectile Weapon Use F Dash Speed
0x12C.description: The speed at which a character moves during a forward dash while firing a projectile weapon.

0x130.name: Projectile Weapon Use B Dash Speed
0x130.description: The speed at which a character moves during a backward dash while firing a projectile weapon.

0x138.name: Light Landing Lag
0x138.description: The length of the character's light landing lag in frames. (Note: <# of real lag frames> = <this value> + 1)

0x13C.name: Normal Landing Lag
0x13C.description: The length of the character's normal landing lag in frames. (Note: <# of real lag frames> = <this value> + 1)

0x140.name: Nair Landing Lag
0x140.description: The length of the character's nair landing lag animation in frames.

0x144.name: Fair Landing Lag
0x144.description: The length of the character's fair landing lag animation in frames.

0x148.name: Bair Landing Lag
0x148.description: The length of the character's bair landing lag animation in frames.

0x14C.name: Uair Landing Lag
0x14C.description: The length of the character's uair landing lag animation in frames.

0x150.name: Dair Landing Lag
0x150.description: The length of the character's dair landing lag animation in frames.

0x154.name: Terminal Velocity Frames for Heavy Landing
0x154.description: How many frames the character must be in terminal velocity for the LandingHeavy animation to play instead of LandingLight. In PM, the character just goes into LandingHeavy always.

0x158.name: HipN Bone ID
0x158.description: Index of the HipN bone on the model.

0x15C.name: Tag Height Value
0x15C.description: The height offset that the nametag will be displayed.

0x164.name: Walljump H Velocity
0x164.description: The starting horazontal velocity obtained from a Walljump.

0x168.name: Walljump V Velocity
0x168.description: The starting vertical velocity obtained from a Walljump.

0x180.name: LHandN Bone ID
0x180.description: Index of the LHandN bone on the model.

0x184.name: RHandN Bone ID
0x184.description: Index of the RHandN bone on the model.

0x18C.name: Water V Acceleration
0x18C.description: The speed at which the character accelerates upward while underwater.

0x1A4.name: Spit Star Size
0x1A4.description: The size of the star effect used when Kirby spits out the character.

0x1A8.name: Spit Star Damage
0x1A8.description: How much damage is dealt when Kirby spits out the character.

0x1AC.name: Yoshi Capture Egg Size
0x1AC.description: The size of the egg when the character is swallowed by Yoshi's Neutral-B.

0x1CC.name: HipN Bone ID (Again)
0x1CC.description: Index of the HipN bone on the model.

0x1E0.name: XRotN Bone ID
0x1E0.description: Index of the XRotN bone on the model.

0x1EC.name: Ice Block GFX Size
0x1EC.description: The size of the block of ice GFX when the character is frozen.

0x1F0.name: Ice Block Break Jump Momentum
0x1F0.description: How much momentum the character gets when breaking out of being frozen.

0x1F8.name: Default V Position of Pause Camera
0x1F8.description: The defualt vertical position the camera is at relative to the character when the game is paused.

0x1FC.name: Camera Size Front
0x1FC.description: The camera pushing effect's distance in front of the character.

0x200.name: Camera Size Back
0x200.description: The camera pushing effect's distance behind the character.

0x204.name: Camera Size Top
0x204.description: The camera pushing effect's distance above the character.

0x208.name: Camera Size Bottom
0x208.description: The camera pushing effect's distance below the character.

0x210.name: Zoom Camera Size Front
0x210.description: The zoom boundaries on the character in the front.

0x214.name: Zoom Camera Size Back
0x214.description: The zoom boundaries on the character in the back.

0x218.name: Zoom Camera Size Top
0x218.description: The zoom boundaries on the character on the top.

0x21C.name: Zoom Camera Size Bottom
0x21C.description: The zoom boundaries on the character on the bottom.

0x220.name: HeadN Bone ID
0x220.description: The index of the HeadN bone on the model.

0x230.name: Pause Camera Zoom Distance
0x230.description: The how far the camera is zoomed when centered on the character during the game being paused.

0x244.name: Magnifying Glass Shrink Ratio
0x244.description: The size of the character in the magifying glass.

0x294.name: 2nd KO SFX Probability
0x294.description: When playing a regular KO sound, there is a 1 in N chance for the alternate one to play, where N is this value.

0x2DC.name: Weight Dependent Throw Speed
0x2DC.description: Controls whether the speed for each throw is affected by weight. Bit set = Independent (---- DUFB)
